Message.Title: Imminent ruling: Big banks like BAC to be broken up. Stock will get crushed. Read at Huff Post.
Message.Msg: The subsidy is unfair, they reckon, and breaking up large financial institutions would stamp it out. The Senate recently passed a nonbinding measure by a 99-0 vote to end the subsidy that results from the implicit government backstop. Brown and Vitter on Wednesday introduced a bill that would force the biggest banks to fund themselves with substantially more equity, rather than with borrowed money. Analysts at Standard & Poor's, the credit rating agency, estimated Thursday that the six biggest banks in the U.S. -- JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Citigroup, Wells Fargo, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley -- would have to raise nearly $1.2 trillion in additional capital to meet the proposed legislation’s requirements.

Message.Title: BAC stock is just a trading vehicle absolutely a broken business model!
Message.Msg: Geeze, I hate to see good people get sucked into thinking that BAC or for that matter any banking stocks can make money in the current economy. Face facts, lending is non-existent to small business, mortgage origination is down the crapper so they take the taxpayers money and gamble in the stock market. They all get burned eventually like the sharks at JPM. If you think you can outwit these crooks you are just mistaken. You win a couple rounds but they will knock you out just like in 2008! Stay away until jobs come back, people can afford homes and mortgages and the FED QE pumping is over!

Message.Title: Officials found guilty in Obama, Clinton ballot petition fraud
Message.Msg: A jury in South Bend, Indiana has found that fraud put President Obama and Hillary Clinton on the presidential primary ballot in Indiana in the 2008 election. Two Democratic political operatives were convicted Thursday night in the illegal scheme after only three hours of deliberations in South Bend. They were found guilty on all counts.

Topic.Title: Big money wants another 300-millisecond advantage

Message.Msg: I agree although it really doesn't bother me because I don't trade on the basis of a tick. What does bother me is that high speed/frequency traders can easily create another flash crash. I seldom use stop loss orders so I wouldn't get sold out on a three minute crash. Lots of smart investors use stop loss and they could get badly burned.

Message.Title: Food for thought, this post was deleted 3 times
Message.Msg: David Yost, a member of Bank of America Corp (NYSE:BAC)’s Board of Directors, purchased 20,000 shares of stock on April 18th at an average price of $11.51 per share according to a Form 4 filed with the SEC.

Message.Title: Breaking News about Bank of America - BAC Mortgage Origination Growing Fast
Message.Msg: Here is why BAC will be cruising past $16 sooner than you can imagine. NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Bank of America (BAC_) is seeing a recovery in its mortgage origination business and could see its market share grow in the coming quarters, according to analysts. The bank was one of only two among the top 10 banks that saw an increase in its origination market share in the first quarter, according to a report from JPMorgan analyst Vivek Juneja. The bank saw mortgage originations rise 57% year-over-year to $23.9 billion in the first quarter, according to the report, giving it an estimated market share of 5%. That is up from a market share of 4.2% in the fourth quarter.

Topic.Title: Breaking News about Bank of America - BAC Mortgage Origination Growing Fast

Message.Msg: Well, considering they used to have 25 - 30% of the market, they have a long way to go. However, a lot of that used to be wholesale loans that they no longer do. The 5% share they have now is solely through their own channels, which is what they were trying to build before they stupidly bought Countrywide. If only....... The point is that they are slowly turning this ship around despite all the gloom and doomers on this board, and elsewhere, who insisted they could never survive. Well, BAC is still here, but it appears most of those gloom and doomers and disappeared.
